data.title: Systems and Networking Reading Group - Spring 2019
data.text:
Paper: Algorand: Scaling Byzantine Agreements for Cryptocurrencies (SOSP ’17), MIT (we may or may not cover it)

Optional (if you want to read more): Learning Scheduling Algorithms for Data Processing Clusters, Hongzi Mao et al., (arxiv)

Optional: CherryPick: Adaptively Unearthing the Best Cloud Configurations for Big Data Analytics (NSDI ’17) Omid Alipourfard, Yale University. Basically they show that you don't (and often times you can't) use some ML techniques to acquire the best(/optimal) solution, choosing sub-optimal solution usually offers better scalability.

Optional (more on serveless): Encoding, Fast and Slow: Low-Latency Video Processing Using Thousands of Tiny Threads (NSDI ’17), Stanford & UCSD (Demo: NSDI video 4:35, 16:14)

Cristina, Connor and I will lead a recap session for NSDI ’19. The format is probably 30 min of brief recap plus 30 min of open question/discussion.
